title: WWE's Matt Riddle weighs in on Ric Flair and Hulk Hogan's return
text:
Ric Flair and Hulk Hogan won’t be wrestling themselves (Picture: WWE)Matt Riddle thinks it is ‘smart’ to keep Hulk Hogan and Ric Flair out of the ring.

The outspoken NXT star – who has become a huge fan favourite on WWE’s third brand – isn’t shy of voicing his opinions, and he admitted he was worried the two long-retired legends would try to turn back time for one more match before they announced they would just be team captains for a 5-vs-5 tag match at Crown Jewel in Saudi Arabia later this month.

Speaking exclusively to Metro.co.uk at WWE’s Performance Center in Orlando, Florida, he laughed: ‘I saw Hogan and Flair [on Raw], and they’re walking around, oh man. And then they said Crown Jewel and I’m like, “they’re gonna wrestle one on one at Crown Jewel?!”

‘Then they said ‘we’re team captains’ – smart move.’

When WWE returns to Riyadh on 31 October, Hogan and Flair will each be lending their name to a team of current superstars, rather than looking to recapture the glory days by dusting off their trunks and boots themselves.

So far, WWE Universal Champion Seth Rollins and the Bulgarian Brute Rusev have been chosen to represent the Hulkster, while the Nature Boy’s squad will feature Randy Orton and King Corbin.

Former UFC star Riddle has been very open about his views on former stars stepping back in the ring, and he was openly critical after Goldberg and The Undertaker’s clash at Super Showdown in Jeddah earlier this year which saw both stars having to redeem themselves in subsequent matches with younger opponents.

Matt Riddle thinks that Ric Flair and Hulk Hogan have made a ‘smart move’ by not putting themselves on the line (Picture: WWE)

This time, though, he admitted he has no problems with Hogan and Flair coming back in a non-wrestling role because they still have a lot to offer in that capacity.

He added: ‘I love Ric Flair and Hulk Hogan – they killed it entertaining us for how many years? It’s fine if they’re not wrestling.’

The Original Bro’s comments are much kinder than those directed at Goldberg, who recently reacted angrily when the NXT star was brought up in a blue carpet interview in Los Angeles and has since admitted his follow-up match with Dolph Ziggler at SummerSlam was a moment of redemption for him.

Despite an apparent snub by the former world champion, Riddle told us he totally understands the idea of people saying what they can to make waves in such a competitive industry.

‘People like to stir up attention and people react,’ he smirked. ‘You know me, I like to stir the pot all the time!’

Friday Night SmackDown airs every week at 1am on Sky Sports Arena and Main Event. WWE will be touring the UK next month with a huge double TV taping featuring both Raw and SmackDown superstars in Manchester on 8 November.
description: The NXT star thinks they've made a 'smart move' as team captains.
